review_blob: Pours clear brown with thin white head. Aroma is sweet and earthy with notes of malt, bread, nuts and slight sweetness. Flavor is sweet and slightly earthy with notes of bread, nuts, light honey, faint toffee notes. Finish is sweet and lightly bready.
beer_name: Cigar City Pilot Series Scottish Export 80/-

review_blob:
Pours hazy yellow with thin white head. Aroma is bready and lightly floral with notes of fruit and grass. Flavor is slightly sweet with slight fruit and funk   
notes. Light and fruity finish.
beer_name: Cigar City Pilot Series Arschgeweih Gose

review_blob: On draft at CCB. I have heard a lot about this one since RBWG, so I was happy to finally try it. Pours pitch black and almost syrupy with tan head. Aroma is a huge burst of strong coffee with notes of chocolate, toffee, molasses. Flavor is another huge burst of coffee, chocolate, fudge, and more coffee. Full body with a thick, syrupy mouthfeel and burnt coffee finish.
beer_name: Cigar City Final Push Imperial Stout

review_blob: On draft at CCB. I have had this beer a few times, and I am really growing to like it more and more. Pours a hazy light amber to copper color with off-white one finger head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of caramel, citrus, grapefruit, pine, light spice. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of citrus, caramel, grapefruit, floral esters. Medium body with a floral hop finish. Another great offering from CCB.

On draft at CCB. Pours almost black with a thin tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of vanilla, ripe dark fruit, chocolate,, brandy, caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with a nice, sweet brandy flavor with notes of chocolate, caramel, light ripe dark fruit. Medium to full body with a lightly boozy finish. Liked this one better than Sound of Big Nuts.
beer_name: Cigar City The Sound of Big Wood

review_blob: On draft at CCB. Pours almost black with a thin tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of chocolate, ripe dark fruit, caramel, brandy, vanilla, light nut overtones. Flavor is about the same with a nice, sweet brandy flavor with notes of chocolate, toffee, nuts. Medium to full body with a lightly boozy finish.
beer_name: Cigar City The Sound of Big Nuts

review_blob: On tap at CCB. Pours a dark brown to black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of roast, coffee, toffee, caramel, some light earthy notes. Flavor is about the same with notes of coffee, bitter coffee, chocolate, caramel, light spice. Full body with a pleasing roasty chocolate finish.
beer_name: Cigar City Soggy Loaf Pumpernickel Rye Porter

review_blob: On draft at CCB. Pours a dark brown to black with tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of chocolate, roast, coffee, toffee, dark fruits. Flavor is about the same with similar notes of chocolate, toffee, roast, coffee. Medium to full body with a roasty, malty finish.
beer_name: Cigar City Puppys Breath Robust Porter

review_blob: On draft at Pourhouse (Tampa, FL). Pours pitch black with dark tan head. Aroma is intoxicating -- loads of sweetness, vanilla, booze, bourbon, chocolate, toffee, molasses, general goodness. Flavor is even better than the nose, even though I couldnt believe it -- chewy with all kinds of sweetness, chocolate, toffee, dark fruits, vanilla, oak, whisky. Full body with a big sweet malty chocolate whisky finish. By far this is likely my favorite CCB beer to date. Hope they make some more.
beer_name: Cigar City Marshal Zhukovs Imperial Stout - Palm Ridge Reserve Barrel Aged

review_blob: 750ml bottle. Pours pitch black with a small dark brown head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of  vanilla, oak, brown sugar, chocolate, oak, light roast. Flavor is sweet and malty with similar notes of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, toffee, chocolate, general goodness. Full body with a pleasing malty and boozy finish. Really well done.
beer_name: Cigar City Marshal Zhukovs Imperial Stout - Double Barrel-aged 2010

review_blob: On tap at CCB. Pours a dark brown to black with tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with roast, chocolate, light coffee notes. Flavor is about the same with a stronger malt presence, some earthy notes and a little more roast. Full body with a nice roast, toasty finish. Nice porter.
beer_name: Cigar City Jos Mart American Porter

review_blob: On tap at CCB. Pours a dark amber copper color with bright white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of spice, cedar, light floral hoppiness. Flavor is about the same with stronger notes of cedar and piny hoppiness. Medium body with a peppery and spicy finish. Really liked the regular 110K Batch 3 and this treatment is just outstanding.

Happened by CCB the day this was on  --  I thought they were kidding about the whole Mr. Beer thing. Nope. Pours an amber to copper color with little head. Aroma is sweet and floral with lots of citrus, grapefruit and hop notes. Flavor is about the same with some maltiness sweetness balancing out the floral hops. Medium body with an interesting finish. A nice surprise. . . .

On draft at the brewery. Pours a dark brown to black with tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of coffee grounds, roast, chocolate, light toast. Flavor is also sweet and malty with similar notes of chocolate, roast, hints of dark ripe fruit and raisins. Medium to full body with a pleasing light roast finish. Nice offering from CCB.
beer_name: Cigar City Death Metal Rye Stout

review_blob: On tap at Brass Tap (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy amber color with one finger white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, pine, grapefruit, caramel balanced with coconut, oak, vanilla, hints of toffee. Flavor is more of the same with stronger notes of oak, vanilla, caramel and somewhat softer floral hoppy notes. Medium body with a pleasing lightly citrusy finish.
beer_name: Cigar City White Oak Jai Alai India Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Knightly Spirits (Orlando, FL). Pours a deep, dark menacing black color with a creamy dark tan head that settles slowly. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of ripe dark fruits, bourbon, oak, vanilla, caramel, toffee, sweety goodness. Flavor is more of the same with some stronger bourbon notes, vanilla, and a lightly smoky note. Full body with a pleasing boozy finish. Wish there was more of this beer to go around.

Bottle. Pours a hazy deep amber orange color with a foamy off-white head. Huge nose of sweet malts, candy sugars, citrus, floral hops, light grapefruit notes -- but the malt dominates the nose. Flavor is also sweet and citrusy with malty notes dominating but subtle piney hops, citrus, and grapefruit notes buried within. Medium body with a sweet and lightly citrusy finish. Seems that most people either love or hate this beer, but Ive had this beer on cask, on draft, and out of the bottle a number of times, and even though they all taste different, I really like this beer. I hope CCB makes it a regular seasonal offering. . . .

Bomber from Whole Foods (Tampa, FL). Pours a dark brown to almost black with some brownish red highlights and thin off white head. Aroma is sweet, floral, malty with notes of citrus, grapefruit, dark malts, light chocolate, hints of roast. Flavor is about the same. Medium body with a pleasing floral hop and citrus finish. Nice black IPA.
beer_name: Terrapin Side Project Captn Krunkles Black IPA

review_blob: 12oz can. Pours a hazy yellow color with thin white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, grapefruit, light floral esters. Flavor is about the same. Medium body with a floral hop finish. Nice IPA.
beer_name: 21st Amendment Brew Free or Die IPA

review_blob: 12oz bottle. Pours a clear brown to black color with reddish highlight, thin white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with some notes of roast, grass, light chocolate, some light funk. Flavor is about the same. Medium body with a lightly roasty malt finish.

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark brown with reddish highlights and thin off-white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of honey, caramel, grass, grain, yeast, earthy notes. Flavor is about the same. Medium body with a malty, earthy finish.

120z bottle courtesy of ericandersnavy. Pours a dark amber with reddish highlights and thin white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of grass, yeast, caramel, honey, earthy notes. Flavor is sweet and malty with similar grassy and earthy notes with sweet floral esters, mild hoppiness, and slight notes of citrus. Medium body with a pleasing malty and hoppy finish. Nice ale.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy, straw yellow color with creamy, white 1 finger head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of caramel, honey, pepper, spice, grass, yeast. Flavor is also sweet and malty, with hints of caramel, honey, yeast, fragrant spice, light pepper, earthy. Medium body with a sweet and spicy finish.

12.7oz bottle from Whole Foods (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy amber reddish color with little head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of sour ripe fruit, light vinegar, barrel, oak, hints of vanilla, dark cherries, funk. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of sweetness coupled with tart ripe fruit and hints of dark floral esters. Medium body, overripe fruit finish.

Bottle courtesy of mfielden. Pours a murky pitch black color with thin creamy tan head. Aroma is intoxicating: whiskey, chocolate, toffee, molasses, vanilla, wood, brown sugar, sweet malty goodness. Flavor is even more impressive -- malty and chocolaty with boozy whiskey notes and sweet caramel, toffee, brown sugar notes. Medium to full body with a boozy malt finish. One of the best bottled barrel aged beers we have had-- a true treat.
beer_name: FiftyFifty Imperial Eclipse Stout - Heaven Hill Rye Barrel

review_blob: Growler from CCB. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with one finger fizzy white head that settles quickly. Aroma is pine, cedar, ash, funk, straw, yeast, some hints of caramel and honey. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of pine, cedar, spice, caramel, honey, light floral esters, spice. Medium body and citrusy pine finish. Interesting ale.

On draft at CCB for the Hunahpu Release. Pours a dark golden to amber/orange with a thin off-white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of sour ripe fruit, fresh tropical fruit, hay, spice, light floral esters. Flavor is about the same with a slightly stronger malt presence, overripe fruit, some hints of caramel and honey. Medium body with a funky and fruity finish. Well done!

Draft at the Hunahpu Release Party. Pours a menacing pitch black color that actually sucks light in and wont release it. Less than one finger creamy tan yellow head that settles nicely on top of the beer. Aroma is pure goodness: Lightly roasty, chocolate, brandy, vanilla, wood, light smoke, ripe dark fruit, molasses, some hints of toffee and brown sugar. Flavor is about the same with a little more heat from the chilis and a little more brandy and booziness. Full body with a  boozy and malty finish. I think I still liked Bourbon Hunahpu best, but with some more time in the barrel, this beer would be even more spectacular.
beer_name: Cigar City Hunahpus Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel Aged

review_blob: Bomber courtesy of mfielden. Pours a muddy dark brown with reddish highlights and tan foamy head that settles somewhat quickly. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of earth, peat, caramel, toffee, raisins, dried grapes, molasses, ripe dark fruit, vanilla, hints of spice. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of chocolate, overripe dark fruit, vanilla, caramel, honey, toffee, molasses, brown sugar. Medium body with a sweet malt finish.

12oz bottle from Total Wine (Tampa, FL). Pours a lightly hazy yellow golden color with one finger white head that settles quickly. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of banana, clove, spice, honey, light caramel, floral esters. Flavor is sweet and floral with similar notes of honey, spice, clove, banana, light caramel, floral esters. Light to medium body with a pleasing malty finish. Easy drinker and not bad.

750ml bottle courtesy of Lunch. Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow to amber with a one finger foamy white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of bread, yeast, grain, spice, caramel, honey, light floral esters. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of caramel, honey, spice, floral esters, yeast, grain, earthy elements. Medium body with a light floral spice and malt finish. Not Duvel, but not bad.

Bomber courtesy of ericandersnavy. Pours a generally clear orange amber color with a one finger foamy white head that settles quickly. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, pine, grapefruit, honey, caramel, floral esters. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of piney hops, citrus, grapefruit, caramel, honey. Generally medium body with a floral hop finish. Nice balance between the hoppiness and malts on this one.

12oz bottle courtesy of ericandersnavy. What a rare treat! This beer pours pitch black with a one finger yellow brown foamy head that settles quickly. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of chocolate, coffee, toffee, caramel, subtle earthiness, molasses, brown sugar. Flavor is sweet and boozy with notes of chocolate, toffee, coffee, lightly bitter maltiness, vanilla, hints of smoke, wood and almost bourbon like notes, some cocoa, molasses, and brown sugar presence as well. Medium to full body with a pleasing malty and boozy finish. Wonderful RIS.

Bomber courtesy of bhalter8. Pours a slightly cloudy dark amber with reddish highlights and one finger off-white foamy head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of booze, bourbon, vanilla, wood, caramel, honey, grain, chocolate, slight funk. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of toffee, grain, yeast, bourbon, booze, yeast, funk, caramel, honey, earthy esters. Medium body with a boozy malty finish.

22oz bottle from Whole Foods (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy orange amber with one finger foamy white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of caramel, sweet candy sugar, cooked veggies/peas, honey, spice, grain, yeast, light floral esters, light spice. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of honey, caramel, candy sugar, light spice, grain, yeast, floral esters. Medium body with a pleasing sweet malty finish.
beer_name: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Yule Tide (- 2012)

review_blob: Bottle from Publix Supermarkets (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy caramel to dark honey color with one finger foamy white head and clearly visible particulates. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of spice, honey, grain, yeast, bread, floral esters, light caramel, light funk. Flavor is essentially the same with sweeter and slightly fruity notes. Some candy sugar and spice comes through. Medium body with a floral honey finish.

120z bottle from Willow Ben (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy lemon color with clearly visible chunky particulates and a creamy foamy white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, lemon, honey, yeast, grain, orange, tangerine, light caramel, floral esters. Flavor is essentially the same with some stronger honey and fruity notes. Light to medium body with a floral finish.

12oz bottle. Pours a dark amber to brown with reddish highlights and one finger white tan head that settles quickly. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of yeast, grain, earth, light chocolate, some floral esters. Flavor is about the same, some very faint roast and slightly more chocolate, malt flavors. Medium body with a malty finish.

12oz bottle from ericandersnavy. Pours a hazy amber to copper with reddish highlights and thin white head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of earth, toffee, nuts, caramel, toffee, light cooked veggies. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of cooked peas, caramel, honey, nuts, earthy peanut butter. Medium body with a malty finish a slight tartness.

Bomber from Whole Foods (Tampa, FL). Pours a crystal clear amber to orange copper color with a one finger foamy white head that settles quickly. Aroma is a blast of hops and malt -- big nose of citrus, pine, grapefruit, caramel, honey, some floral esters. Flavor is about the same -- strong notes of floral hops, citrus, grapefruit, pine, caramel, honey, floral esters. Medium body with a strong hop finish.
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Hop Dam Triple IPA

review_blob: Bomber of unknown vintage. Pours a hazy amber color with reddish highlights and a less than one finger white bubbly head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of caramel, toffee, maple syrup, chocolate, light floral esters, some hints of toffee and floral hops. Flavor is sweet and malty with similar notes of caramel, toffee, molasses, brown sugar with just a touch of floral hoppiness and floral esters. Medium body with a boozy and malty finish. Nice ale.

Bomber from Whole Foods (Tampa, FL). Pours a generally clear amber to copper color with one finger white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with pleasant notes of floral hops, citrus, grapefruit, light pine, caramel, honey. Flavor is wonderful -- sweet and floral, malty, nicely balancing the fruity hops and the caramel maltiness. Medium body with a pleasing hop finish. Nice ale.

2009 bottle. Pours a hazy caramel to copper color with massive white pillowy two finger head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of barrel, yeast, caramel, funk, floral esters, malty sweetness. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of caramel, floral esters, yeast, funk, honey, hay, overripe fruit, barrel, wood. Medium body with a pleasing fruity tart finish.

On draft at Florida Brewers Guild Fest (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy orange to amber color with one finger white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, floral hops, big bouquet of tropical fruit (this really comes through in the nose) and some apricot and caramel notes. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, grapefruit, ripe tropical fruit, floral hops, malty sweetness. Medium body with a floral and sweet finish.

On draft at Florida Brewers Guild Fest (Tampa, FL). Pours a pitch black color with slight mahogany highlights and one finger off-white head that settles quickly. Aroma is sweet and roasted with notes of chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, nuts, caramel. Flavor is roasted and malty with notes of smoke, chocolate, earth, nuts, roast, caramel and hints of toffee. Medium body with a smoky and chocolaty finish.
beer_name: Cigar City Patio Tools Dry Irish Stout

review_blob: On tap at the Florida Brewers Guild Fest (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy orange to almost caramel color with thin white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of citrus, grapefruit, ripe fresh fruit. Flavor is much of the same with a slightly more bitter hop presence and stronger citrus flavors. Light to medium body with a floral hop finish.

12oz bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy amber color with lots of reddish tones and a massive foamy white head that settles quickly. Aroma is sweet raspberries, overripe fruit, caramel, light funk. Flavor is sweet and slightly sour, ripe fresh fruit, light funk, hints of maltiness. Light to medium body with a fruity finish.

Draft. Pours a dark amber color with just a touch of haze and a one finger bright white head. Aroma is interesting -- lots of floral sweetness, light floral hoppiness, fresh fruit, overripe apples, a slight sweet funkiness. Flavor is sweet and hoppy with notes caramel, overripe fruit, floral esters, yeast. Medium body with a lightly floral hop finish. More hoppiness comes out the more I drink the beer. The more I drink it, the more it seems like a really sweet Jai Alai. Interesting.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear dark copper color with a thin whitish head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of caramel, pine, citrus, grapefruit, floral esters, hops, honey. Flavor is about the same but with more hop bitterness. Medium body with a floral hop finish. Enjoyable, but not outstanding.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy, brown to black with reddish highlights and foamy 1 finger white head. Aroma is sweet and malty, with notes of chocolate, caramel, honey, yeast, grain, and light notes of burnt molasses. Flavor is about the same. Medium body. Earthy malt finish.
